article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-13Pkiku hentry entry story-marquee-standard

h2.a: The Most Dangerous Countries For Tourists, In Maps

div.p: The recent assaults in Brazil and India have raised questions about those countries' safety records. Here are the places where travelers should actually be wary.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-ZyaKBM hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: What Makes Rain Smell So Good?

div.p: Step outside after the first storm after a dry spell and it invariably hits you: the sweet, fresh, powerfully evocative smell of fresh rain. If you’ve ever noticed this mysterious scent and wondered what’s responsible for it, you’re not alone.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10v9IaN hentry entry story-col-1

header.div: MORE TO BEEF THAN MEATS THE RIBEYE

h2.a: Cuts Of Beef, Visualized

div.p: An easy-to-use guide to cuts of beef. The chart shows where each cut of meat comes from on the cow, how much it costs and how to best cook it.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10mmaMr hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: Photos Of Modern Day Locations Blended With Shots Of Major Historical Events

div.p: The photographer shot photos at locations around the world where major historical events happened, and then blended old photos showing those events from the same perspective.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-16jeZoV hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Shakespeare: Hoarder, Playwright, Fake?

div.p: In the absence of solid evidence, statistics can help you decide for yourself.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YurcY7 hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Hauntingly Gorgeous Photos Of Prostitutes In Greece

div.p: Greek photojournalist Myrto Papadopoulos brings us these beautiful, almost otherworldly photos of prostitutes in their workplaces. The ongoing photo project, called The Attendants, examines Greece’s ever-evolving sex industry and its relationship with the economic crisis.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-17bAICF hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: Saudi Arabia To Forcibly Paralyze Man For Crime He Committed 10 Years Ago

div.p: The reported sentencing of paralysis for a Saudi man as punishment for paralysing another man has been described as "outrageous" by a leading human rights group.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-XC0mOm hentry entry story-col-0

header.div: NOT TO VERIFY YOUR CREDIT CARD

h2.a: Why Retailers Ask For Your ZIP Code

div.p: Retailers like to ask for all sorts of information as they’re ringing up your merchandise, like your e-mail address and ZIP code. I just want to pay and be on my way, and they give me the third degree.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-Z4Yuj7 hentry entry story-col-1

header.div: SURELY WILL DO BETTER THAN THE KIN

h2.a: This Is (Probably) The New Facebook Phone

div.p: According to well-known tipster evleaks, this is it.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YQMVsL hentry entry story-col-2

header.div: OR WAIT TIL 2015 AND SEE IT FOR YOURSELF

h2.a: Check Out The View From The Top Of The New World Trade Center

div.p: The three-floor observation deck at "the top of this rising phoenix" will not be open until 2015, but here's a glimpse into the blue-skied future.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YPiOSw hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: How The Aryan Brotherhood Kills

div.p: The white supremacist gang has a chillingly efficient structure. Christine Pelisek on how its jailhouse generals rule—and why the recent string of Texas killings may not be their doing.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YYJ2it hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Why You Hate The Sound Of Your Own Voice

div.p: Unfortunately, my recorded voice is what everyone else hears all the time. So why does it sound so unfamiliar to me?

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10uXnVn hentry entry story-col-2

header.div: AS IF YOU NEEDED ANOTHER REASON TO SWITC

h2.a: Blackberry Messenger Might Share Your Porn Habits With Your Friends

div.p: Users at the Crackberry forums have unveiled what they're calling a dirty little flaw in the push update capabilities of the new Blackbery Z10.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10uBd5C hentry entry story-col-0

header.div: YOU READ IT FOR THE ARTICLES, RIGHT?

h2.a: Will Anyone Pay For A Nudity-Free Playboy iPhone App?

div.p: People claim to read the seminal "men's magazine" for the articles. Thanks to Apple's porn ban, we may soon find out how many actually do.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-11gsIgZ hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: 6 Ways Of Looking At College Hookup Culture

div.p: According to a new book, casual sex in college is plentiful, mandatory, and unfulfilling, leading to an epidemic of bad sex.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YtCEmO hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: Will Allergies Be Worse In 2013?

div.p: Experts say that an earlier arrival of spring and a longer growing season, along with increased precipitation and humidity from storms, will all potentially contribute to the increased presence and persistence of allergens.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-11gKUXP hentry entry story-col-0

header.div: MADE IN CHINA, BUT BY WHOM?

h2.a: 94% Of Americans Cannot Name One Chinese Brand. Can You?

div.p: Look around your house, look around your office. What percentage of products do you think were made in China? Based on market data, chances are that number is close to 50%. Now name one Chinese brand. Commence awkward silence.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YQGnum hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: In Spain, A Mattress That Lets Your Money Rest Easy

div.p: Spaniards wary of trusting their life savings to their country's shaky banking system can now buy a mattress that has an armored safe equipped with a keypad combination lock hidden in one end.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YtGrRd hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: The Oldest Surviving Aerial Photograph

div.p: If you had access to a balloon and a camera in 1858 Paris what would you do?

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-Z2B51Q hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: How Did This Man Get Caught Dangling Upside Down On Power Cables?

div.p: A drunken man in China dangles upside down on a high-voltage power cable and refuses to come down.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-XbvxP6 hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Twitter's Silent Partner

div.p: Jason Goldman helped build Google and Twitter into what they are today — but few outside of tech's inner circle know his name. On shunning the spotlight in a star-obsessed industry.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10ldeWs hentry entry story-col-2

header.div: WHERE HAVE ALL THE WILDINGS GONE?

h2.a: A Graphic Tribute To 'Game Of Thrones'

div.p: Find out where loyalties began, how they changed, or they betrayed one another. See who has no loyalty at all.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-11hJJaG hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Shoelace Killer Sprints To Freedom From Texas Prison

div.p: Two inmates — one accused of strangling someone with a shoelace — used their feet to make a mad dash to freedom Tuesday when they successfully broke out of a Texas prison.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-13OrcGB hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: American Sperm Is So Hot Right Now

div.p: The sperm trade is growing ever larger and ever more international, with more and more kids being born via unknown fathers on distant continents. By some estimates, the United States is the world’s largest exporter of sperm, sending vials to dozens of countries every year.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YrtfME hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: What It Actually Costs To Live In Japan

div.p: Does living in Japan really cost as much as people say it does?

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-17b7Zh6 hentry entry story-col-0

header.div: HOPE TO AVOID THE DREADED MARS LAYOVER

h2.a: How NASA's Nuclear Rockets Will Take Us Way Beyond Mars

div.p: The first people to step on to the surface of Mars won't arrive aboard the chemical-fueled rockets that delivered Apollo 11 to the Moon. Instead, NASA is turning to long-ignored nuclear-thermal rocket technology to deliver the first Martian explorers into history.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-XVCYqE hentry entry story-col-1

header.div: AND ARE HAPPY TO TELL POLLSTERS ABOUT IT

h2.a: A Shocking Number Of Americans Believe In Conspiracy Theories

div.p: 28% of voters believe a secretive power elite with a globalist agenda is conspiring to eventually rule the world through an authoritarian world government, or New World Order.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-11cI1Ho hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: How To Solve Unemployment: Print Money And Mail Checks

div.p: Fight unemployment by giving money directly to American families.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-14C5rZZ hentry entry story-col-0

header.div: FIRST THEY CAME FOR THE SOUP

h2.a: No Using The Soup Nazi’s Likeness To Sell Guns For You!

div.p: The nation has been gratuitously stretching Seinfeld's "No soup for you!" to fit its needs. Gun-maker Serbu Firearms was the latest to do so for commercial purposes, using the angry guest star's face on a T-shirt to protest New York's new gun laws.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-Y5jOSO hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Tracking The History Of Animal Consciousness

div.p: T hese are stimulating times for anyone interested in questions of animal consciousness. On what seems like a monthly basis, scientific teams announce the results of new experiments, adding to a preponderance of evidence that we’ve been...

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YZdMjw hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: Spoilers, Screenerbrags And Squabbles: How Film Critics Use Twitter

div.p: Are critics too quick to tweet their thoughts after screenings?

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10ix3ir hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Why Is Coffee The Only Thing Americans Buy 'Fair Trade'?

div.p: Your ethically pure latte may in fact be helping the people who produced it, but no necessarily the way the label implies.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YZ3cJ3 hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: How To Tell If A Woman Is Faking An Orgasm

div.p: You'll never be 100% sure, but here are some things to look for.

h2.a: How To Magically Cook Scrambled Eggs In The Shell
